metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17675 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
WordPress before 5.2.4 does not properly consider type confusion duringvalidation of the referer in the admin pages, possibly leading to CSRF.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 5.2.4+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.4+dfsg1-1').
